required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Frequency Analysis of Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-centered Investigation Into the Frequency Domain Patterns in Vessels of Patients With Coronary Artery Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if coronary artery disease can be detected using an electronic, acoustic recording instrument. The presence or absence of abnormal pathology will be confirmed by diagnostic angiography as part of the normal patient care at this institution.

primary_outcome.measure: to determine if coronary artery disease can be detected using an electronic, acoustic recording instrument
primary_outcome.description: to determine if coronary artery disease can be detected using an electronic, acoustic recording instrument

study_pop.textblock: Patients presenting to the University of Minnesota Medical Center (UMMC) Fairview Clinics, Physicians (UMP) or the Redwing, Minnesota clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18-89 years old and recommended for a cardiology related angiogram within 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any patient less than 18 years of age or greater than 89 years of age.
- Any patient with any of the following conditions: pregnant or nursing, prior myocardial infarction, left ventricular device, heart transplant, valve replacement, congestive heart failure, atrial fibrillation (non-intermittent), endocarditis or any heart viral or bacterial infection, any patient who has or requires medication or other heart rhythm altering treatment.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

facility.name: University of Minnesota Medical Center (UMMC) Fairview Clinics
